titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Correspondence, Series 2
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Correspondence, Series 2 FA808
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Barbara J. Gilson, Lee R. Hiltzik

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-08-26 00:16:45 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Correspondence, Series 2

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes some of the Institute's earliest correspondence in regard to grants, experimental animals, vivisection, serum production, experimental work and business matters including (2 inches) York & Sawyer file regarding construction of the Hospital. Includes administrative letters written by Simon Flexner, members of the Scientific Directors, administrative officers and a few by Jerome Greene. One volume copy-book (1905-1906) mostly by Simon Flexner. Names included are listed below.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order in volume, in alphabetical order in boxes.

did.unittitle: Bashford, E.F. (includes background for proposed International Association for Cancer Research)
Billings, Frank (Nomination to National Academy of Sciences)
Evaluation of new Michael Reese Hospital)
Billings, John S. (infection from books and cards in Astor Library)
Castle, W.E. (Harvard - regarding mice cages and animal breeding)
Councilman, W.T. (Regarding grants; hardships for medical researchers)
Corwin, R.W. (Colorado Fuel and Iron Co. Use of Carrel-Dakin method in industrial accidents)
Cummins, G. Wyckoff (1910 letter re death of child from polio and illness in chickens)
Cutting, R. Fulton (1906 formation of Committee for clean milk in NYC)
Dabney, Charles W. (1908-1909 President, University of Cincinnati)
Eagleton, Wells P. Recommendation for Dr. Martland)
Edsall, David L. (Medical developments at University of Penn)
Elkins, Stephen B. (Check to Rufus Cole)
Elsberg, Charles A. (appointment at Institute with Meltzer)
Embree, Edwin Rogers (possible replacement for Jerome Greene)
Ernst, Harold C. (Journal of Medical Research)
Farrand, Livingston (Association for study and prevention of TB)
Hornsby, J.A. (refers to Jobling) Hospital Bureau of Standards Houghton, Henry S.
Interstate Commerce (transport cost of small animals)
La Forge, F.B. (Letters from P.A. Levene and Pshorr)
Lillie, Frank R. (Wood's Hole: Dr. Loeb)
National Assoc. for Advancement of Colored People
Neuman, Leo H. (New York Medical Society; anti-vivisection)
Norton, Charles D. (Acoustic patient; reference to Wallace C. Sabine)
Pathology (Charles W. Howard, William H. Tytler. Henry K. Marks) appointments
Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts

Warthin, Aid red Scott (Peyton Rous fellowship)
Whistling of boats in East River
Wolff-Eisner (re. publication of handbook on serumtherapy)
Wood's Hole (building of laboratory for Dr. Loeb)
Woodward, R.S. (Carnegie Institution. Noguchi vol. on snake venom)
Wyman, Walter (advisory board of Hygienic Lab.)
York & Sawyer (Hospital construction. Includes letter from J.D. Rockefeller Jr. dated 6/25/1910 accepting revised plans)
